Description of incident: The compromised information included Social Security numbers and grades from master's alumni classes 1997 through 2004, job offer information from master's alumni classes 1985 through 2004, contact information for all alumni, and Social Security numbers and grades from doctoral students enrolled between 1998 and 2004.  Between 5,000 and 6,000 of those affected had their credit card information and Social Security numbers compromised. Emails and letters were sent to those who were affected.
